Who We Are Description: PatchUp is an innovative smart pothole reporting and management platform designed to improve road safety and infrastructure maintenance in Sri Lanka. Our mission is to empower citizens to report potholes easily and transparently, while enabling local authorities to act faster and more effectively.
Our Vision Description: To create safer, better-maintained roads for everyone by bridging the communication gap between the public and local authorities.
Our Mission Description:
• Enable real-time pothole reporting through a simple mobile and web platform.
• Provide transparency and accountability in road repairs.
• Foster community involvement by allowing users to validate reports and track progress.
• Help authorities prioritize repairs using accurate data and analytics.
Why PatchUp Description:
• Real-time Reporting: Capture pothole images, GPS location, and descriptions instantly.
• Community Validation: Users can upvote and confirm existing reports to ensure critical issues are addressed quickly.
• Authority Integration: Reports are routed directly to the correct municipal council through dashboards.
• Multilingual Support: Available in Sinhala, Tamil, and English for maximum accessibility.
• Offline Reporting: Users can submit reports even without internet connectivity.
Our Team Description:
PatchUp was developed by a passionate group of students at Level 5 (COMP50022: Commercial Computing, SEENG2421):

• Dillon Fernandez (CB012663)
• Hiranya Nirmal (CB012776)
• Sanura Devjan (CB012596)
• Akshith Rithushan (CB013331)

Together, we are committed to making roads safer and empowering communities.
Contact Us Description: We’d love to hear from you! Whether you have questions, feedback, or partnership opportunities, feel free to reach out.
Terms and Conditions Welcome Description: Welcome to our Pothole Reporting System. By using our service, you agree to the following terms and conditions:
Terms and Conditions 1 Description: Our pothole reporting system is designed for the general public in Sri Lanka to report potholes and related road issues. You must be at least 18 years old to use this service.
Terms and Conditions 2 Description: To use the service, you must create an account by providing your name and email address. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account information.
Terms and Conditions 3 Description: To report potholes accurately, the system requires access to your device’s location and permission to send notifications. By using the service, you agree to enable location services and notifications.
Terms and Conditions 4 Description: You may submit pothole reports, including descriptions and photos. You agree that all information you provide is accurate and truthful. Submitting false or misleading reports is prohibited.
Terms and Conditions 5 Description: We collect your name, email, and pothole reports solely to provide and improve the service. Your personal data will not be shared with third parties except as required by law.
Terms and Conditions 6 Description: This service is free to use. There are no payments involved, and no refunds apply.
Terms and Conditions 7 Description: This service operates only within Sri Lanka. Reports submitted from outside this area may not be processed.
Terms and Conditions 8 Description: We do our best to forward reports to the appropriate authorities but do not guarantee any repairs or actions. We are not liable for any damages, delays, or inaccuracies related to pothole repairs.
Terms and Conditions 9 Description: We may update these terms occasionally. Continued use of the service means you accept any changes.
